prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. We need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies. Let me start by going through each testimony and cross-referencing with the evidence provided.

Testimony 0 to 4 are all from Ihmus. The key testimony here is Testimony 4 where Ihmus claims to have seen the accused stab the high priest with a dagger. But according to the Rites Guide (Evidence 1), during the Purification Rite, the high priest dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra and then the priestess (Lady Kee'ra) enters the spring. The problem arises because Maya's Statement (Evidence 8) says that when they arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. If the Rite of Water involves the priestess entering the spring, and the water was already stained when they arrived, that suggests the stabbing happened before the rite even started. But Ihmus claims to have seen the stabbing during the rite. Wait, but the timing here might be conflicting.

Wait, looking at Evidence 1 again: The Purification Rite begins with the Transformation Rite where the high priest puts on the robes. Then the Rite of Water where the priestess enters the spring. If the water was already red when Maya and the high priest arrived (Evidence 8), that means the blood was there before the Rite of Water started. But the murder would have to occur during the rite if Ihmus saw it during the rite. But the water being red upon arrival suggests the stabbing happened earlier, maybe before the rite. So there's a contradiction here because Ihmus claims to have seen the stabbing during the rite, but the water was already red when they arrived, implying the stabbing was before the rite started. Therefore, the testimony about seeing the stabbing during the rite contradicts the evidence that the blood was present before the rite's Rite of Water phase.

Alternatively, maybe the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) was closed during the rite, so how could Ihmus see through it? The curtain isolates the sanctum, so using binoculars to spy on the rite from Mt. Poniponi (Testimony 3) would be impossible if the curtain was closed. Wait, Evidence 4 says the entrance was shut during the rite, so the curtain was closed. Therefore, Ihmus couldn't have seen inside the sanctum during the rite. That directly contradicts Testimony 3 and 4 where he claims to have spied on the rite using binoculars and saw the stabbing. So if the curtain was closed, he couldn't have seen anything inside, making his testimony impossible. 

So the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 (using binoculars to spy on the rite) and Evidence 4 (the ritual curtain was shut, blocking the view). That seems like a solid contradiction. The evidence (4) says the curtain was isolating the sanctum, entrance shut. Therefore, spying on the rite from outside wouldn't be possible. Hence, Ihmus's testimony about seeing the stabbing during the rite is impossible because the curtain was closed. Therefore, the evidence that contradicts the testimony is Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) and Testimony 3 or 4. Let me check the exact wording. Testimony 3 says he used binoculars to spy on the rite. Evidence 4 says the curtain was shut. So those two directly contradict each other because the curtain was closed, making the rite not visible from outside. So the answer would be evidence 4 and testimony 3.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of evidences and testimonies, along with characters. The goal is to find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies. There are three testimonies from Ihmus. 

Testimony 0: Ihmus says he saw shadowy silhouettes projected against the ritual curtain. Testimony 1 claims the figures were created by the light of the full moon on a clear night. Testimony 2 states that even though it was a shadow, he could tell the accused was reverse-gripping the dagger.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain, which mentions that the entrance was shut during the rite. Evidence 1, the Rites Guide, says that the Purification Rite begins when the moon is directly over Mt. Poniponi. The Rites Guide also mentions that there's a curtain around the sanctum, isolating it. Evidence 11, the Mountain Range Poster, states that Mt. Poniponi is west (2298m) and the Inner Sanctum is east (2310m). The moon was over Mt. Poniponi (west), so the light would be coming from the west. But the Ritual Curtain is around the sanctum, which is east. If the moon is west, then the light source would be from the west, casting shadows eastward onto the curtain. However, the sanctum is east, so the curtain is around the sanctum. Wait, perhaps the curtain is surrounding the sanctum, so the light from the west (moon over Mt. Poniponi) would cast shadows towards the curtain. But according to Testimony 1, the figures were created by the full moon's light. However, Evidence 2 (May 9th Newspaper) mentions that the weather that night had a cold front moving in overnight, but during the day it was clear. Wait, the newspaper's weather forecast says that the area around the Inner Sanctum would have calm, clear skies today (the day of the rite), but a cold front would move in overnight. The Purification Rite ends two days later at noon. So the rite starts when the moon is over Mt. Poniponi. The testimony says "that night", which would be the night the rite began. The newspaper says clear skies during the day but a cold front at night. Wait, the newspaper's weather section says: "calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature... Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight." So the night of the rite would have a cold front, which might bring clouds. If the testimony says the figures were created by the full moon's light on a clear night, but the cold front moving in overnight would mean cloudy skies, possibly obscuring the moon. So maybe the testimony about the moon's light (Testimony 1) is contradicted by the weather forecast (Evidence 2), which indicates that the night had a cold front, which might mean clouds, making the moonlight unlikely. 

Alternatively, another contradiction: Testimony 0 and 1 say that the shadows were projected by the moon. But the curtain (Evidence 4) was closed, so how could the moonlight project the shadows? Wait, the curtain is around the sanctum, isolating it. If the curtain was closed, then the sanctum is enclosed. But if the curtain is a perimeter around the sanctum, then the shadows would be projected onto the curtain from inside. But the moon is outside. So if the curtain is closed, how would the moonlight from outside cast shadows onto the curtain? Unless the curtain is translucent. But if the curtain is a solid barrier, the light from inside (like a lantern) would cast shadows. But Testimony 1 says the light was from the full moon. So if the curtain was closed, the moonlight couldn't enter, making it impossible for the shadows to be projected by the moon. Therefore, Testimony 1 (about the moonlight creating the figures) would contradict Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain closed during the rite), because the closed curtain would block the moonlight from entering, making the shadow projection impossible. 

Wait, Evidence 4: Ritual Curtain's description says the entrance was shut during the rite. So the sanctum is enclosed by the curtain, with the entrance closed. The moon is outside. So if the curtain is closed, the moonlight can't enter the sanctum. Therefore, the shadows on the curtain would need an internal light source. But Testimony 1 claims the figures were created by the full moon's light. That contradicts because the closed curtain would block the moonlight. So Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) contradicts Testimony 1 (light from full moon). 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 1's description: the Rites Guide mentions that during the Rite of Fire, the priestess circles the sacred flames. So maybe there's a fire inside, providing light. If the curtain is closed, the fire's light inside would cast shadows on the curtain. But the testimony says the light is from the full moon. So that's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 4 (closed curtain) and Evidence 1 (Rites Guide, which says the curtain is in place). 

So the contradiction is between Testimony 1 (moonlight creating the shadows) and Evidence 4 (closed curtain blocking outside light). Therefore, the evidence would be 4 and testimony 1. Let me check the numbers. Testimony 1 is the second testimony from Ihmus. The Evidence 4 is Ritual Curtain. So the JSON should be {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 1}. 

Alternatively, maybe another angle. Let me check the Inner Sanctum Photo (Evidence 7), which shows a lantern with a broken wind guard. If the lantern was the light source, maybe it was used to create the shadows. But Testimony 1 says the light was the full moon. That would be a contradiction. But how does that tie into the evidence? The broken lantern might indicate that the light source was unstable. But if the curtain was closed, the lantern inside would be the light source, contradicting Testimony 1's claim about moonlight. 

So the main contradiction is Testimony 1 (moonlight) vs Evidence 4 (closed curtain). Therefore, the answer is Evidence 4 and Testimony 1.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The task is to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. The user has given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My job is to cross-examine these to find a contradiction.

First, I need to go through each testimony and see if any evidence directly contradicts it. Let's look at the testimonies first. The person giving these testimonies is Ihmus, which might be a nickname or alias. The testimonies are numbered 0 to 6.

Testimony 3 says: "No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!" This suggests that the cliffs are not climbable, implying that access to the Inner Sanctum via the cliffs is impossible. 

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 11 is the Mountain Range Poster, which describes Mt. Poniponi and the Inner Sanctum's heights and locations. The Inner Sanctum is at 2310 meters east, and Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters west. But how does this relate to the cliffs being unclimbable? Hmm. Maybe the poster shows the proximity or the layout, making it possible to traverse between them despite the cliffs?

Wait, another evidence: Evidence 2 is the May 9th Newspaper. It mentions that the thick ice that had frozen the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion has melted, allowing the rite to proceed. If the ice melted, maybe the path became accessible again. But Testimony 3 is about cliffs with loose rocks, not ice. Maybe not directly related here.

Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain, which isolates the sanctum. Testimony 4 says the plaza gate is locked from the Inner Sanctum side. But that's a different testimony. Let me check again.

Testimony 3's claim is that the cliffs are unclimbable. But if there's evidence showing that someone could have climbed or that the cliffs aren't as bad as described, that would contradict it. Let's check Evidence 11 again. The poster gives the heights. Maybe the difference in elevation between Mt. Poniponi and the Inner Sanctum could be relevant. If the Inner Sanctum is higher, maybe there's a way to descend from there? Or perhaps the poster shows that the cliffs aren't as steep as claimed. Alternatively, Evidence 26 is a Rebel Hideout Photo, but I'm not sure how that ties in.

Wait, Evidence 27 is the Warbaa'd Statue, which is described as a revolving door with sharp feathers that killed Zeh'lot. But that's about the murder weapon. Not directly related to cliffs.

Looking back at Testimony 3: "No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!" So the claim is that the cliffs are impossible to climb. If there's evidence that shows someone did climb them, that would contradict it. For example, maybe the escaped prisoner (Evidence 2's newspaper mentions an escaped prisoner) might have climbed, but that's speculative.

Wait, the Mountain Range Poster (Evidence 11) gives specific heights. If Mt. Poniponi is 2298m and the Inner Sanctum is 2310m, the difference is only 12 meters. Maybe the poster shows that the two locations are close enough that one could traverse between them without climbing the cliffs. Alternatively, the photo in Evidence 11 might show a possible path that's not obvious. But the testimony says the cliffs are loose and crumbly, making climbing impossible. If the poster indicates that there's an alternative route or that the cliffs aren't as bad, that would contradict.

Alternatively, Evidence 19 is a Brand New Flag with some writing. Not sure. Evidence 6 is Sanctum Prayer Flags sewn into a long banner. Maybe they were used as a rope to climb? But that's more of a stretch.

Wait, the newspaper (Evidence 2) mentions that the ice had melted, making the rite possible. If the path was previously blocked by ice but now is clear, maybe the cliffs are not the only access. But Testimony 3 is about the cliffs specifically. If the ice melting allowed a different route, maybe the cliffs weren't necessary. However, the testimony says that besides the locked gate (Testimony 4), the cliffs are another impossible access point. So if there's evidence that someone could have accessed via the cliffs despite Testimony 3's claim, that would be a contradiction.

Alternatively, Evidence 25 is the Golden Orb, which is a key to the rebel hideout. Not directly related. Evidence 26 is the Rebel Hideout Photo with a luminol reaction, indicating blood. Maybe the hideout is near the cliffs, but again, not sure.

Wait, maybe the Mountain Range Poster (Evidence 11) shows that Mt. Poniponi and the Inner Sanctum are adjacent or connected in a way that the cliffs between them are not as high as claimed. For instance, if the Inner Sanctum is east and Mt. Poniponi is west, but the difference in elevation is only 12 meters, maybe it's possible to traverse between them without climbing the cliffs. Alternatively, the poster's photo might show that the cliffs aren't as steep as described. If the poster's photo in Evidence 11 visually contradicts the claim about the cliffs being unclimbable, then that's the contradiction.

So, Testimony 3 says the cliffs can't be climbed due to loose rocks. Evidence 11's Mountain Range Poster might show the actual geography, indicating that the cliffs are climbable, or that there's another route. Therefore, Evidence 11 contradicts Testimony 3.

Alternatively, let me check the other testimonies again. Testimony 2: "Besides, it woulda been impossible to get there in the first place!" which is a general statement. Testimony 3 gives a specific reason (cliffs). Evidence 11's poster could show that getting there is possible via another route, but that's more about Testimony 2. However, Testimony 3 specifically mentions the cliffs, so Evidence 11's geographic data might directly contradict that.

Therefore, the contradiction would be between Evidence 11 and Testimony 3.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain

Evidence 5

Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants only one pair, so I have to look through all the given evidence and testimonies to find inconsistencies.

First, let me list out the testimonies. All of them are from Ihmus. Testimony 3 says that gale force winds came out of nowhere, leading to an emergency landing at the sanctum. But looking at the evidence, there's Evidence 2, the May 9th Newspaper. The weather forecast section mentions calm and clear skies on the day of the rite, with a cold front moving in overnight. So if the emergency landing happened during the evening of the rite day, the weather should have been calm then. But Ihmus claims there were gale force winds. That's a contradiction because the newspaper reports calm weather that day. Therefore, Evidence 2 (the newspaper) contradicts Testimony 3 (about the gale force winds).
